answers.author: Kathryn Berkenpas
answers.text:
You do not have to begin taking Required Minimum Distributions (RMDs) from your 457 retirement plan until age 70 ½, or when you retire from your employer- whichever happens later.  Therefore, as long as your employer does not consider you separated from service, you do not have to begin taking RMDs, even though you are over age 70 ½.   These rules do not apply to Traditional IRAs or any employer-sponsored retirement plans from past employers, so even though you are still working for the City of Sausalito, you may have to take RMDs from other accounts you own.  
You can contribute to your City of Sausalito 457 as long as you are employed with the city.  However, you cannot contribute to an employer-sponsored retirement plan after you separate from service, so after you retire, you will no longer be eligible to contribute to the City of Sausalito 457.  If you are still working after you retire from the City of Sausalito, you could consider contributing to a Roth IRA.  You can only contribute earned income to a Roth IRA (so you would have to be working somewhere else), but these accounts do not require RMDs because the money goes into the account after-tax.

text:
I have a 457 group plan with the City of Sausalito, where I previously worked full-time, but now work part-time.
Because I'm 70 1/2, do I  have to withdraw the minimum distribution?    Also, can I continue to contribute independently
from Sausalito?   If so, how do I go about that?     
   thank you,    Penny Greene   plan # 300198      Ref code  RBRVRNFY
